Title: Administration & Personal Assistant (English & Chinese Speaking)
Job Description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a proactive and highly organized Administration & Personal Assistant who is fluent in Chinese and English to support senior management. The ideal candidate will handle a wide range of administrative, secretarial, and basic HR tasks, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and effective communication within and outside the organization.

Key Responsibilities
1. Executive & Secretarial Support
Manage daily schedules, meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for senior management.
Prepare meeting materials, take meeting minutes, and follow up on action items.
Handle confidential documents and communications with discretion.
Assist in translation (written and verbal) between Chinese and English, Vietnamese as needed.

2. Administrative Support
Manage office supplies, equipment, and vendors.
Draft official letters, reports, emails, and other business documents.
Organize and maintain filing systems (both digital and hard copies).
Liaise with external partners and internal teams to coordinate activities and logistics.

3. HR & General Affairs
Assist with onboarding/offboarding processes.
Maintain staff records and attendance tracking.
Support basic payroll, insurance, and work permit processing.
Assist in organizing company events, meetings, and team activities.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, HR, Foreign Languages, or related fields.
Proven experience in personal assistant, admin, or HR roles (minimum 3 years preferred).
Fluent in Chinese and English (both written and spoken).
Strong organizational and time-management skills.
High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.
Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Positive, service-minded attitude and strong communication skills.

Title: Senior Executive, Business Analyst - Digital & CRM (Salesforce)
Location: Viettel Complex Building, 6th floor, Block A2, 285 Cach Mang Thang 8, Ward 12, District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, 5th Floor, Viettel Complex Tower, 285 Cach Mang Thang Tam Street, Ward 12, District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
1. Business Intelligence and Project Support: 60%

The job will support the implementation of new IT projects, promote the best practices and suggest process and functionalities enhancements to enhance Business efficiency and user adoption (This position is based in Vietnam and serves a regional function, supporting Digital Business and CRM operations for Cummins DKSH in Thailand, Vietnam, and Myanmar). You  will also participate in the timely execution of the regional reporting to facilitate the decision making of the top management.

- Supports operational excellence and integration of existing projects (CRM/Service/Marketing automation), support new project integration

- Contribute to the testing and debugging of new software or enhancements to existing software

- Assist in the enforcement of project deadlines and schedules

- Interact sessions with business users and development team

- Suggest new features to existing software to support Business Efficiency and Users adoption

- Support User adoption and learning by developing new training materials

- Preparation and execution of the Monthly reporting

- Build relationships with key DKSH stakeholders

2. Data Management and End-User Support: 40% 

The job will facilitate the creation, maintenance, and validation of our master data within our CRM Salesforce.com and the integrated projects. You will assume data management responsibilities currently performed by the team which will allow the team to focus on deliverables. You will use technical tools and best practices to analyze and measure DKSH Technology data quality and develop action plans to ensure the accuracy, completeness and compliance of our enterprise data with the necessary standards:

- Ensure accuracy and integrity of Salesforce.com data

- Analyze and identifies data sources, data redundancy and implement processes to remediate data issues and/or data clean-up efforts

- Analyze and resolves cross-functional data issues across Salesforce.com modules:

- Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

- Demonstrate skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information, inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data

- Lead and perform data cleansing through periodic review

- Manage ongoing support requests and administrative needs

- Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner

- Support in the user activation and deactivation process as needed

- Participates in the execution and implementation of approved data definitions, policies, standards, and process data access

- Manage new user onboarding and training

- Ensure good adoption rates for all countries
Job Requirements:
- Ability to learn and become proficient quickly with new tools

- Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, focus on detail

- Proactive, committed and insure follow-up in a very timely manner

- Excellent organizational, prioritization, independent decision-making skills and communication skills

- Team player, ability to interact and communicate with all levels of management

- Demonstrated commitment to our fundamental principles of Integrity

- Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience

- Proficiency with English communication (Being a regional point of contact for CRM and digital business initiatives across Cummins DKSH Thailand, Vietnam, and Myanmar)

- At least 5 years' experience in project management, data management environment with database management, executing data imports, running exports, merging records, and running reports

Title: Graphic Designer
Location: Ree Tower, 3rd Floor, 9 Doan Van Bo street, District 4, Ho Chi Minh City, Ree Tower, 3rd Floor, 9 Doan Van Bo street, District 4, Ho Chi Minh City
Job Description:
Job Overview:
We are looking for a highly skilled and creative Graphic Designer with a strong portfolio and at least 5 years of experience in visual communication. This role involves creating compelling visual assets for digital and print media, collaborating with marketing and product teams, and supporting our brand's visual consistency. In addition to core graphic design skills, the ideal candidate has a good eye for photography, basic video editing capabilities, and is comfortable experimenting with AI-based video tools.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design and produce engaging visuals for branding, marketing campaigns, social media, website, packaging, and other communication materials.
- Collaborate closely with the marketing and content teams to translate ideas into visually impactful designs.
- Create assets that align with brand guidelines and maintain visual consistency across platforms.
- Assist in product photography or creative shoots when needed.
- Edit short-form videos for digital channels (social media, website, ads, etc.).
- Explore and apply AI-powered tools for video creation and content enhancement.
- Manage multiple design projects and deliver on-time under tight deadlines.
Job Requirements:
Requirements:
- Minimum 5 years of experience as a Graphic Designer or in a similar creative role.
- Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign; After Effects or Premiere is a must).
- Strong portfolio demonstrating a wide range of design styles and outputs.
- Understanding of layout, typography, color theory, and visual storytelling.
- Basic experience with video editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, CapCut, or similar).
- Ability to take high-quality photos and a good sense of composition and lighting.
- Familiarity with AI tools used for content and video creation (e.g., Runway, Pika, or similar).
Preferred Traits:

- Humble – Open to feedback and able to work collaboratively with minor ego.
- Hardworking – Willing to take initiative and put in the effort to meet deadlines and goals.
- Good listener – Able to understand briefs clearly and adapt to client/stakeholder feedback with a positive attitude.

Title: Senior Process Engineer
Location: KCN Nam Tân Uyên, Khánh Bình, Tân Uyên, Bình Dương, Việt Nam, Lot A, Nam Tan Uyen IP, Tan Uyen Town, Binh Duong
Job Description:
* PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY:
• New product introduction (NPI): Design for Manufacturability (DFM) Review and provide feedback to customer, create process flow diagrams, define critical process parameters, select appropriate equipment, and establish efficient assembly methods. Create create and maintain Bills of Materials, build instructions, conducting process trials, and addressing any issues or challenges that arise during the NPI build.
• Process Analysis: Analyze existing manufacturing processes to identify areas for improvement in terms of efficiency, productivity, quality, and cost-effectiveness. This includes studying process flows, conducting time studies, and gathering data to identify bottlenecks and opportunities for optimization.
• Process Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of manufacturing processes, including process flow diagrams, standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and equipment specifications. Ensure that documentation is up to date and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
• Component evulation: Participate in evaluating the raw material and new supplier/ vendor with SQE, review and propose to customer for alternative component.
• Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including production, engineering, and quality assurance, to identify and implement process improvements. This may involve proposing and testing new techniques, technologies, or equipment to enhance productivity, reduce cycle times, minimize waste, or improve product quality.
• Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to manufacturing processes to monitor performance, identify trends, and drive decision-making. Use statistical tools and software to analyze data and generate reports, enabling informed process optimization and problem-solving.
• Troubleshooting and Problem Solving: Investigate and resolve issues related to manufacturing processes, equipment failures, and product quality deviations. Work closely with production and maintenance teams to identify root causes, implement corrective actions, and prevent future occurrences.
• Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives, such as Lean Manufacturing or Six Sigma, to promote a culture of continuous improvement. Contribute to projects aimed at reducing waste, improving efficiency, and enhancing overall process performance.
• Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, operators, technicians, and management, to ensure effective communication and alignment on process improvement initiatives. Share findings, recommendations, and progress updates with relevant stakeholders.
• Support Supervisor/ Manager to train for new staff and perform other related duties as designed by superior.
Job Requirements:
1. Education: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, preferably in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
2. Experience:
• At least an additional 5 years related to PCBA engineering experience or box-build parts assembly such as metal part, plastic part and cable.
• Poka-Yoke mindset and concept.
• Solid understanding of engineering principles and product development concepts.
• Basic knowledge of computer-aided design (CAD) software for product design and modification.
• Familiarity with product testing methodologies and data analysis.
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail in documentation and reporting.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
• Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to collaborate with team members and present technical information.
• Ability to work well in a team environment and contribute to cross-functional projects.
• Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
• Basic understanding of quality control principles and standards.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
• Proficiency in the English language (reading, writing, speaking and comprehension).
• Self-motivated with a strong desire for professional growth and development.
